We write further to our email to you dated 22 November 2024 reminding you to send us a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence in respect of the above.  We note that we have still not received a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.
4.	Fines and penalties being levied by ADGM.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Regards

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Dear Mohammed,

 

Your ADGM trade licence expired on 20 November 2024 and we note that we have yet to receive your renewed licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Ethics & Compliance Executive

CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.

Dear Sharon,

 

Your ADGM trade licence is due to expire on 20 November 2024.  We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Dear Mohammed,

We write further to our email to you dated 22 November 2024 reminding you to send us a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence in respect of the above.  We note that we have still not received a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.
4.	Fines and penalties being levied by ADGM.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Regards

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Ethics & Compliance Executive

Dear Mohammed,

 

Your ADGM trade licence expired on 20 November 2024 and we note that we have yet to receive your renewed licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Dear Sharon,

 

Your ADGM trade licence is due to expire on 20 November 2024.  We would like to take this opportunity to remind you to renew this on time and provide us with a copy as soon as you have done so.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease. 

 

Please let me know if you have any questions.

 

Regards,

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

We write further to our email to you dated 13 December 2024 reminding you to send us a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence in respect of the above.  We note that we have still not received a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.
4.	Fines and penalties being levied by ADGM.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Regards

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Following on from Alya’s earlier email,  ADGM Enforcement Office has the right to serve a Cease and Desist notice on Max Mara on 21 December as this will be the end of the 30 day grace period.  After this they can close the store and impose fines on the Company for failing to have a valid Trade Licence.

 

I would be grateful if you would expedite this matter.

 

Rebecca 

 

Rebecca Lane​​​​

Dear Mohammed,

 

We write further to our email to you dated 22 November 2024 reminding you to send us a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence in respect of the above.  We note that we have still not received a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence.  Kindly provide this as soon as possible.

 

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

In the event that you have not yet obtained your new trade licence, then please ensure that you apply for it immediately (if you have not already done so) and provide us with a copy within seven (7) days’ of this email.

 

Please note that you are obliged to obtain and at all times maintain your ADGM trade licence under the terms of your Lease with us and your failure to do so may result in further action from both us and ADGM.  This may include some or all of the following:

 

1.	Incurring penalties under the Lease.
2.	Termination of the Lease.
3.	Closure of the retail unit and disruption to trade.
4.	Fines and penalties being levied by ADGM.

 

In the event that you fail to provide us with a copy of your renewed ADGM trade licence within seven (7) days’ of this email, then we will have to pass this matter to our Legal department.

 

We reserve all of our rights under the Lease and all Applicable Law.

 

Regards

 

 

Alya Al Ameeri​​​​

Ethics & Compliance Executive
